awd_titl_txt: Heat Generation and Transport in Submicron Semiconductor    Devices
awd_abstract_narration: Energy generation and transport in sub-micrometer electronic                    devices do not obey continuum laws such Ohm's law and                           Fourier's law. It is proposed to study such processes both                      theoretically and experimentally. The theoretical model                         considers the electrons, optical phonons and acoustic phonons                   to be three thermodynamic systems which exchange energy                         between themselves.  The constitutive relations for heat and                    particle fluxes are obtained from the Boltzmann transport                       equation. With appropriate conservation laws the model will                     predict the temperatures of electrons, optical phonons and                      acoustic phonons, as well as density of charge carriers and                     electrical conductivity. The experimental effort will focus on                  developing a new technique of nanometer-scale temperature                       measurement, making use of the atomic force microscope. The                     measured temperatures will be compared with theoretical                         predictions.
